title: 114_hr4531
content: SECTION 1. APPROVAL OF THE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE REPUBLIC OF PALAU. Definitions: Agreement refers to the document signed by the United States and Palau on September 3, 2010. Compact of Free Association is the agreement between the US and Palau. Results of Compact Review: Amendment to Public Law 99-658 to include a section on the outcomes of the Compact review. The Agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau signed on September 3, 2010 is approved, with exceptions and subject to certain provisions. If Palau withdraws over $5,000,000 from the trust fund in fiscal year 2015, funds may be withheld. In fiscal year 2015, funds payable under the Compact of Free Association may be withheld from Palau until they reimburse the trust fund for amounts withdrawn over $5,000,000. The Secretary of the Treasury shall transfer necessary funds to the Secretary of the Interior for certain provisions under the Compact. The Secretary of the Interior is authorized to implement sections of the Agreement by providing necessary sums, which will remain available until expended without further appropriation. Additionally, $1,500,000 is authorized to subsidize postal services to Palau, the Marshall Islands, and Micronesia for fiscal years 2016 through 2024. The Secretary of the Interior is authorized to provide necessary sums for Federal entities under the Compact of Free Association. Section 3 of the Act of June 30, 1954 is repealed. Payment schedules and funding for the Compact section 211(f) fund are outlined in the Agreement. The Compact section 211(f) fund is outlined in the Agreement. The US government will contribute $30,250,000 to the Fund in accordance with a schedule from fiscal year 2016 to 2023. Additionally, a grant of $12,000,000 will be provided in fiscal year 2016, and $2,000,000 annually from fiscal year 2017 to 2024 for infrastructure maintenance. The agreement establishes the 'Infrastructure Maintenance Fund' to maintain capital improvement projects funded by the US, with Palau matching contributions of $150,000 quarterly from 2016 to 2024. Additionally, a fiscal consolidation fund is outlined in the agreement. The agreement includes a fiscal consolidation fund. The Government of the United States will provide Palau with $10,000,000 in fiscal year 2016 to reduce government arrears. Additionally, the US will give Palau $45,750,000 in economic assistance, with $10,000,000 allocated for fiscal year 2016. The agreement outlines funding amounts for fiscal years 2016 to 2023, starting at $10,000,000 and decreasing annually. Economic assistance funds will be provided quarterly unless specified otherwise. The agreement outlines funding amounts for fiscal years 2016 to 2023, starting at $10,000,000 and decreasing annually. Economic assistance funds will be provided quarterly unless specified otherwise. Infrastructure projects are addressed in Section 5. The Government of the United States will provide $40,000,000 to Palau for infrastructure projects in fiscal year 2016. Amendments to the Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 extend programs until 2024. The Secretary of the Interior will fund audits required by the Agreement. Section 236 of the Compact applies to commitments and amounts, with a substitution of "2010" for "1981". Passport requirement under Section 141 of Article IV of the Compact of Free Association is to be interpreted accordingly. "Passport requirement under Section 141 of the Compact of Free Association is to be interpreted accordingly." Individuals in specific categories may be admitted to engage in occupations and establish residence in the US without certain restrictions if they hold a valid, machine-readable passport that meets international standards. This includes individuals who were citizens of the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands on September 30, 1994, and are now citizens of Palau, as well as those who acquire Palauan citizenship. An individual who acquires Palauan citizenship at birth or through naturalization and has been a resident for at least five years can accept employment in the US with permission from the Secretary of Homeland Security. They may also establish habitual residence in a US territory or possession, subject to non-discriminatory limitations. Non-discriminatory limitations may apply to Palauan citizens acquiring rights or lawful permanent resident alien status in the United States, as authorized by relevant statutes or regulations. This does not grant the right to establish residence for naturalization or petition for benefits under the Immigration and Nationality Act.
